StructureLaunchPad Plataforma de Lançamento de Foguete Modular
StructureModularRocketCargo01 Módulo Carga de Foguete O módulo de carga tem capacidade para dois engradados de dez slots. Você pode ter vários módulos de carga em seu foguete. O foguete pode levantar até sete módulos no total. Esta carga será lançada em órbita e descerá a superfície do seu destino. A menos que seja o cinturão de asteróides, caso em que será deixado flutuando serenamente no vazio.
StructureModularRocketCommand01 Módulo Comando de Foguete O módulo de comando deve ser colocado em cima do foguete e avaliará a prontidão do foguete para o voo. Quando todas as condições forem atendidas, o foguete poderá ser lançado quando todos os jogadores estiverem sentados no módulo pressionando 'IGNITION' no console.
As seguintes condições devem ser atendidas para o lançamento:
- Combustível cheio - Relação de mistura de combustível correta - uma mistura 2:1 de {GAS:Volatiles} e {GAS:Oxygen}. - Todos os jogadores sentados - Energia fornecida ao {THING:StructureLaunchPad} - Foguete totalmente construído
The {THING:StructureModularRocketCommand01} console displays the current state of these conditions. It does not require an atmosphere for lift off - your suit’s atmosphere is sufficient. Ao pousar, o foguete implantará um módulo de pouso e qualquer carga contida no módulo {THING:StructureModularRocketCargo01}.
DynamicModularRocketCommand01 Módulo Comando de Foguete
StructureReverseElectrolyzer Eletrolisador Reverso
H2Combustor Combustor H2 Um pouco adaptado de seu design original {LINK:Recurso;Recurso}, o Combustor {GAS:Volatiles} faz exatamente o que seu nome sugere - ele queima uma mistura de voláteis e {GAS:Oxygen} para criar água. Extremamente útil em ambientes quentes ou áridos, os usuários precisam estar cientes de que o combustor produz calor residual considerável. O dispositivo também não é perfeitamente eficiente, resultando na autoignição de voláteis na câmara e na produção de gases residuais que devem ser tratados.

StructureInsulatedPipeCrossJunction5 Tubo Adiabático (Junção de 5 Vias) Os tubos adiabáticos reduzem muito a perda de calor dos gases armazenados neles.

ItemAdvancedTablet Tablet Avançado O tablet {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} Padi 2 avançado é uma versão aprimorada do {THING:ItemTablet} básico, com dois slots {LINK:CartridgePage;cartridge}. O Padi 2 aceita {THING:CartridgeAtmosAnalyser}, {THING:CartridgeTracker}, {THING:CartridgeMedicalAnalyser}, {THING:CartridgeOreScanner}, {THING:CartridgeElectronicReader} e vários outros cartuchos.
ItemKitInsulatedPipe Kit (Tubo Adiabático) Este kit produz variedades de {THING:StructureInsulatedPipeStraight}, que reduzem bastante a perda de calor dos gases armazenados neles.
StructureModularRocketEngine01 Módulo Motor de Foguete O motor de foguete modular é capaz de levantar até sete módulos, incluindo ele mesmo. Ele deve ser alimentado por pelo menos um {THING:StructureModularRocketFueltank01}.
StructureModularRocketFueltank01 Módulo Tanque de Combustível de Foguete O tanque de combustível do foguete requer uma mistura 2:1 de {GAS:Volatiles} e {GAS:Oxygen}. Se a mistura exceder essas proporções ou você colocar outros {LINK:GasPage;gases} no tanque, o console {THING:StructureModularRocketCommand01} exibirá um erro "Invalid".
Observe que o tanque de combustível do foguete também pode ser usado para coletar gás extraído pelo {THING:StructureModularRocketGasMining}, quando conectado a essa unidade por um {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp} ou {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown}.

StructureBatteryLarge Station Battery (Large) Providing even better large-scale, reliable power storage than the {THING;StructureBattery}, the {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} 'Da Dianchi' large station battery is the heart of most {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} bases. There are a variety of cautions to the design of electrical systems using batteries, and every experienced Stationeer has a story to tell, hence the Stationeer adage: 'Dianzi cooks, but it also frys.' {HEADER:POWER OUTPUT} Able to store up to 9000001 watts of power, there are no practical limits to its throughput, hence it is wise to use {THING:ItemCableCoilHeavy}. Seasoned electrical engineers will also laugh in the face of those who fail to separate out their power generation networks using an {THING:StructureAreaPowerControl} and {THING:StructureTransformer}.

StructureHarvieReversed Harvie Use above a {THING:StructureHydroponicsTray} or {THING:StructureHydroponicsTrayData} to manage the planting and harvest of your crops. Rover_MkI Rover MkI A distant cousin of the jeep, the Mk I {{LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} electric rover is one of the most simple and durable light vehicles in the known universe. Able to carry two passengers and cargo such as the {THING:DynamicGasCanisterAir} or {THING:Crate}, it is powered by up to three batteries, accepting everything including {THING:ItemBatteryCellNuclear}. A quad-array of hub-mounted electric engines propels the reinforced aluminium frame over most terrain and modest obstacles. While the Mk I is designed for stability in low-horizontality circumstances, if it rolls, try using your {THING:ItemCrowbar} to put it right way up.

StructureGrowLight Grow Light {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero's} leading hydroponic lighting system, the GrowUp UV light supplements sunshine in low light or sun-distant conditions. The unit adds growability over the space of a grid, so requires proximate placement to work.
ItemKitGrowLight Kit (Grow Light) This kit produces an {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero} {THING:StructureGrowLight}.
StructureWeatherStation Weather Station
ItemKitWeatherStation Kit (Weather Station)
ItemKitUprightWindTurbine Kit (Upright Wind Turbine) This kit produces a {THING:StructureUprightWindTurbine}.
StructureUprightWindTurbine Upright Wind Turbine Norsec's basic wind turbine is an easily fabricated, rapidly deployed design that is strong enough to withstand the worst that environments can throw at it. While the wind turbine is optimized to produce power even on low atmosphere worlds (up to 200W), it performs best in denser environments. Output varies with wind speed, and during storms, may increase dramatically (up to 800W), so be careful to design your power networks with that in mind.
CrateMkII Crate Mk II A more heavily reinforced version of the iconic {THING:DynamicCrate}, the Crate Mk II is resistant to incredibly high pressures and temperatures. Short of disposing of it in a black hole, the Mk II is about as safe as luggage gets.
ItemKitCrateMkII Kit (Crate Mk II) This kit produces a {THING:CrateMkII}.
ItemEmptyCan Empty Can Used for making soups when combined with food in the {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine} or {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine}. Fairly high in nutrition, canned food does not {LINK:DecayPage;decay}.
ItemPumpkinSoup Pumpkin Soup Made using {THING:ItemCookedPumpkin} and an {THING:ItemEmptyCan} in a {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine} or {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine}. Fairly high in nutrition, canned food does not {LINK:DecayPage;decay}
ItemCornSoup Corn Soup Made using {THING:ItemCookedCorn} and an {THING:ItemEmptyCan} in a {THING:AppliancePackagingMachine} or {THING:StructureAdvancedPackagingMachine}. Faily high in nutrition, canned food does not {LINK:DecayPage;decay}.
ItemBreadLoaf Bread Loaf
ItemBiomass Biomass Diced organic material that is returned when food and organic matter is passed through the {THING:StructureRecycler} and {THING:StructureCentrifuge}. Can be burned in a {THING:StructureFurnace} into {THING:ItemCharcoal} for use in the {THING:StructureSolidFuelGenerator}.
StructureHydroponicsTrayData Hydroponics Device The {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero} hydroponics device is the ideal vessel for growing a range of {LINK:OrganicPage;plantlife}. It must be supplied with water using a pipe network, and sufficient light to generate photosynthesis. It can be automated using the {THING:StructureHarvie}. Note that unlike the {THING:StructureHydroponicsTray}, these cannot be placed consecutively as they are considered devices rather than pure pipes. They do, however, allow data interrogation for logic systems.
ItemCharcoal Charcoal Charcoal is a lightweight, black carbon residue produced by heating {THING:ItemBiomass} in a {THING:StructureArcFurnace}. It contains less energy potential than {THING:ItemCoalOre}, but can be used as a basic fuel source. Charcoal can also be substituted for coal in {LINK:IngotPage;alloy} recipes.
ItemKitSolarPanelReinforced Kit (Solar Panel Heavy) This kit produces heavy duty solar panels that are resistant to storm damage.
ItemKitSolarPanelBasicReinforced Kit (Solar Panel Basic Heavy) This solar panel is resistant to storm damage.
StructureSolarPanel45Reinforced Solar Panel (Heavy Angled) This solar panel is resistant to storm damage.

StructureSolarPanelFlatReinforced Solar Panel (Heavy Flat) This solar panel is resistant to storm damage.

ItemAstroloySheets Item Astroloy Sheets
ItemMiningBeltAdvanced Mining Belt MK II The Mk II mining belt is similar to the {THING:ItemMiningBelt}, but has 13 slots instead of the basic 8, to increase the length of your mining trips. It also has space for two tools.
StructureWindTurbine Wind Turbine The Stationeers wind turbine was first designed by Norsec atmospheric engineers, looking to create a wind-driven power generation system that would operate even on exceedingly low atmosphere worlds. The ultra-light blades respond to exceeedingly low atmospheric densities, while being strong enough to function even under huge strain in much more demanding environments. While the wind turbine is optimized to produce power (up to 500W) even on low atmosphere worlds, it performs best in denser environments. Output varies with wind speed and, during storms, may increase dramatically (up to 10,000W), so be careful to design your power networks with that in mind.
ItemKitWindTurbine Kit (Wind Turbine) This kit produces a {THING:StructureWindTurbine}.

ItemWaterBottle Water Bottle Delicious and pure H20, refined from local sources as varied as Venusian ice and trans-Solar comets. Empty bottles can be refilled using the {THING:StructureWaterBottleFiller}.
ItemWaterBottleFiller Water Bottle Filler As its somewhat uninspired name suggests, this device refills a {THING:ItemWaterBottle}, when connected to a liquid pipe network.
StructureWaterBottleFiller Water Bottle Filler
StructureIceCrusher Ice Crusher The {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} KoolAuger converts various ices into their respective {LINK:GasPage;gases} and liquids. A remarkably smart and compact sublimation-melting unit, it produces gas or liquid depending on the ice being processed. The upper outlet is gas, the lower for liquid, and while you can attach any pipe you like to either oulet, it will only function if the correct network is attached. It will also only pass gas or liquid into a network if it is powered and turned on. If the KoolAuger is full, it will not accept any further ice until the gas or liquid contents is drained. In this state, it will flash a yellow error state on the activation switch.
ItemKitIceCrusher Kit (Ice Crusher) This kit creates a {THING:StructureIceCrusher}.
DynamicGasTankAdvancedOxygen Portable Gas Tank Mk II (Oxygen)
DynamicGasTankAdvancedWater Portable Liquid Tank Mk II (Water) An insulated version of the {THING:DynamicMKIILiquidCanisterWater}, you are able to store water in this {SLOT:GasCanister} without them gaining or losing temperature.
StructureLiquidPipeRadiator Liquid Pipe Convection Radiator A simple heat exchanger, pipe radiators can be placed on pipes to shed or gain heat, depending on the temperature of the surrounding atmosphere. If the atmosphere is hotter, heat will be added to the liquid within the pipe network, and visa versa if colder. In a vacuum, heat will be radiated. The speed of heat gain or loss will depend on the liquid in question. Adding multiple radiators will speed up heat transfer.
ItemPipeLiquidRadiator Kit (Liquid Radiator) This kit creates a {THING:StructureLiquidPipeRadiator}.
DynamicMKIILiquidCanisterEmpty Portable Liquid Tank Mk II An empty, insulated liquid {SLOT:GasCanister}.
ItemKitDynamicMKIILiquidCanister Kit (Portable Liquid Tank Mk II)
DynamicMKIILiquidCanisterWater Portable Liquid Tank Mk II (Water) An insulated version of the {THING:DynamicMKIILiquidCanisterWater}, for storing liquids without them gaining or losing temperature.
StructureLiquidVolumePump Liquid Volume Pump
ItemLiquidPipeVolumePump Kit (Liquid Volume Pump)
ItemKitLiquidRegulator Kit (Liquid Regulator)
StructureBackLiquidPressureRegulator Liquid Back Pressure Regulator
StructureLiquidPressureRegulator Liquid Pressure Regulator
ItemLiquidCanisterSmart Liquid Canister (Smart)
ItemMKIIScrewdriver Mk II Screwdriver This standard issue frictional adherence adjustor is a top of the line, bi-rotational model with a columnated uni-grip. It's definintely not just a screwdriver. Use it for construction and deconstruction of certain kits, and setting values on {LINK:LogicUnitPage;logic} units. The MK II is more resistant to temperature and pressure.
ItemMKIIAngleGrinder Mk II Angle Grinder Angles-be-gone with the trusty angle grinder. The MK II is more resistant to temperature and pressure.
ItemMKIICrowbar Mk II Crowbar {LINK:Recurso;Recurso's} entry-level crowbar is useful in a variety of everyday {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} settings, from opening {THING:StructureAreaPowerControl}s and unpowered {THING:StructureAirlock}s, to splatting pan-dimensional headcrabs, should the need arise. The MK II is more resistant to temperature and pressure.
ItemMKIIArcWelder Mk II Arc Welder
ItemMKIIDrill Mk II Drill The {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} Off-whirled Hand Drill has been a companion to {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} for decades. Essential for assembling and deconstructing various items and structures, regardless of gravity, pressure or temperature.
ItemMKIIMiningDrill Mk II Mining Drill The handheld 'Topo' tri-cone rotary mining drill was made for one thing: quick digging. Modelled on a classic {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} zero-g design, it functions equally well in vacuum and atmosphere, with cemented carbide bits to increase resilience and bearing life, and reduce spalling. As Jenk Murtons once said, 'The Topo don't stopo.' The MK II is more resistant to temperature and pressure.
ItemMKIIWireCutters Mk II Wire Cutters Wirecutters allow you to deconstruct various {LINK:StructurePage;structures}, as well as cross-lay cables when held in your non-active hand, and defuse explosives as needed. Wirecutters are stored in the {THING:ItemToolBelt}, along with other essential {LINK:ToolPage;tools}.
ItemMKIIWrench Mk II Wrench One of humanity's enduring contributions to the cosmos, the wrench represents the essence of our species. A simple, effective and spiritually barren tool, use it to build and deconstruct a variety of {LINK:StructurePage;structures} The MK II is more resistant to temperature and pressure.
ItemMKIIDuctTape Mk II Duct Tape In the distant past, one of Earth's great champions taught a generation of 'Fix-It People' that duct tape was the answer to any problem. {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} have demonstrated that this is truth holds strong, so long as the problem is a damaged {THING:ItemEvaSuit}, {THING:ItemJetpackBasic}, {THING:ItemSpaceHelmet}, or even a {THING:StructureSolarPanel}. To use on yourself: put duct tape in your active hand, hold RIGHT MOUSE BUTTON to automatically repair damage.

StructureRocketModuleSilo Automated Rocket Silo Module The {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} autononmous silo module provides storage for {LINK:OrePage;ores} collected by the {THING:StructureRocketModuleMiningOre}, {LINK:OrePage;ices} collected by the {THING:StructureModularRocketIceMining} and 'space junk' salvaged by the {THING:StructureModularRocketScrapMining} . In other words, it holds up to 600 'medium-sized dry goods'. The silo module must be connected to a mining or salvage module by a correctly placed {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}, in order for material to pass into the silo. The silo module must also be powered when on the launch pad. It is 'on' by default, but can be turned off with logic if needed. The module can also be attached to a {THING:StructureChuteInlet} in order to connect it to {LINK:ImportExportPage;import/export} networks. To extract resources from the silo module, you must set its state to 'OPEN' using logic.
StructureRocketModuleBattery Automated Rocket Energy Storage Module Coming soon
StructureRocketModuleGasCollector Automated Rocket Gas Collection Module Collects gas from space by magic.
StructureRocketModuleEnergyGenerator Automated Rocket Energy Collection Module Collects energy by electromagnetically capturing the solar wind. Stores it in the {THING:StructureRocketModuleBattery}. Coming soon
StructureRocketModuleMiningJunk The module must be connected to a {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo} by a properly placed {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}, in order for {LINK:OrePage;ore} to pass from the collector unit into the silo.
StructureRocketModuleMiningOre Automated Rocket Ore Mining Module The {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} autonomous {LINK:OrePage;ore} miner harvests metallic ores from asteroids and planets in the local region of space. Its range - and therefore how much {LINK:OrePage;ore} it collects - is strictly determined by the rocket's fuel quantity. The module must be connected to a {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo} by a properly placed {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}, in order for {LINK:OrePage;ore} to pass from the collector unit into the silo. It has two modes - active (1), and inactive (0), which should only be triggered when the rocket has arrived on the planet and is idle (mode 4).
StructureModularRocketAutonomous Rocket Modular Autonomous
StructureRocketModuleCollectorLiquid Automated Rocket Liquid Harvesting Module Coming soon
StructureModularRocketAutomation Automated Rocket Automation Module The automation module completes the rocket. It passes logic to its respective components.
StructureModularRocketCouplingDown Automated Rocket Coupling Module (Down) A uni-directional, multi-state conveyance solution, the coupling module is designed to interface between various mining and storage modules. It is essential for the function of the mining unit. When placed BELOW a mining module (eg {THING:StructureRocketModuleMiningOre}), the DOWN coupler passes mined or harvested material (solid, liquid or gas) into the respective storage unit (eg {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo}).
StructureModularRocketCouplingUp Automated Rocket Coupling Module (Up) A uni-directional, multi-state conveyance solution, the coupling module is designed to interface between various mining and storage modules. It is essential for the function of the mining unit. When placed ABOVE a mining module (eg {THING:StructureRocketModuleMiningOre}), the UP coupler passes mined or harvested material (solid, liquid or gas) into the respective storage unit (eg {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo}).

Its range - and therefore how much ice {LINK:OrePage;ore} it collects - is strictly determined by the rocket's fuel quantity. The module must be connected to a {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo} by a properly placed {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}, in order for {LINK:OrePage;ore} to pass from the collector unit into the silo. It sweeps the local region of space for wrecks, abandoned space shipments, and other detritus. As such, it returns a fairly random assortment of items. The module must be connected to a {THING:StructureRocketModuleSilo} by a properly placed {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingDown} or {THING:StructureModularRocketCouplingUp}, in order for {LINK:OrePage;ore} to pass from the collector unit into the silo.

ItemKitHeatExchanger Kit Heat Exchanger This kit creates a {THING:StructureHeatExchangeLiquidtoGas}, {THING:StructureHeatExchangerLiquidtoLiquid} and {THING:StructureHeatExchangerGastoGas}.
StructureHeatExchangerLiquidtoLiquid Heat Exchanger - Liquid The original specs for the N Series Flow-P heat exchanger were rumored to have been scrawled on the back of a burger receipt by a bored {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} designer riding up the Brazilian space elevator, but that hasn't stopped it becoming one of the most widely-copied heat exchanger designs in the Solar System. The 'N Flow-P' has four connections, allowing you to pass two liquid networks into the unit, which then works to equalize temperature across the two separate networks. As the N Flow-P is a passive system, it equalizes pressure across the entire of each individual network, unless connected to liquid management devices like a {THING:StructureLiquidVolumePump} or a {THING:StructureBackLiquidPressureRegulator}.
StructureHeatExchangerGastoGas Heat Exchanger - Gas The original specs for the N Series Flow-P heat exchanger were rumored to have been scrawled on the back of a burger receipt by a bored {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} designer riding up the Brazilian space elevator, but that hasn't stopped it becoming one of the most widely-copied heat exchanger designs in the Solar System. The 'N Flow-P' has four connections, allowing you to pass two gas networks into the unit, which then works to equalize temperature across the two separate networks. As the N Flow-P is a passive system, it equalizes pressure across the entire of each individual network, unless connected to gas management devices like a {THING:StructureVolumePump} or a {THING:StructureBackPressureRegulator}.
StructureHeatExchangeLiquidtoGas Heat Exchanger - Liquid + Gas The original specs for the N Series Flow-P heat exchanger were rumored to have been scrawled on the back of a burger receipt by a bored {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} designer riding up the Brazilian space elevator, but that hasn't stopped it becoming one of the most widely-copied heat exchanger designs in the Solar System. The 'N Flow-P' has four connections, allowing you to pass separate liquid and gas networks into the unit, which then works to equalize temperature across the two separate networks. As the N Flow-P is a passive system, it equalizes pressure across the entire of each individual network, unless connected to devices like a {THING:StructureVolumePump} or a {THING:StructureBackLiquidPressureRegulator}.
StructureHeatExchangeLiquidAndGas Heat Exchange Liquid And Gas

LogicStepSequencer8 Logic Step Sequencer The {LINK:ODA;ODA} does not approve of soundtracks or other distractions. As such, {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} have had to create their own musical accompaniment to the demanding labor of building and maintaining off-world infrastructure. Central to this pasttime is the step sequencer, which allows Stationeers to sequence short musical patterns or loops.
{HEADER:DIY MUSIC - GETTING STARTED}
1: Connect 8 {THING:DeviceStepUnit}s to your step sequencer via the data port on the lefthand side.
2: Label each step unit, then assign step units 1 through 8 on the step sequencer using the screwdiver.
3: Select the output speaker (eg {THING:PassiveSpeaker}) where the sequencer will play the sounds. This needs to be connected to the logic network on the righthand side of the sequencer.
4: Place a {THING:StopWatch} and use a {THING:StructureLogicReader} and {THING:StructureLogicWriter} to write the time to the time variable on the sequencer.
5: Set the BPM on the sequencer using a {THING:StructureLogicDial} and a {THING:StructureLogicWriter} to write to the sequencer's BPM variable. A higher bpm will play the sequence faster.
6: Insert a sound cartridge of your chosing and select which variant of sound you wish to play by pushing the arrow buttons located above and below the sound cartidge slot.
7: Choose the pitch of the sounds to play by setting the dial on each of your 8 step units to the desired note. With drums, each note is a different drum sounds. You can trial your sounds by pushing the activate button on each step unit (with the sequencer inactive).
8: Get freaky with the {THING:DeviceLfoVolume}.
9: Finally, activate the sequencer, Vibeoneer.
DeviceStepUnit Device Step Unit

DecayedFood Decayed Food When your {LINK:OrganicPage;food} decays, it turns into this. {LINK:ODA;ODA} scientists have attempted to determine the exact constituents of this substance, but it remains evasive and mysterious. Suffice to say, eating it is a bad idea. Research has determined, however, that The exact speed of decay varies individually by:
- TEMPERATURE - Refrigeration will slow decay, but many foods will be damaged by exposure to extreme low pressure, as well as extreme heat. The optimum temperature is 0 kelvin (-272 C).
- FOOD TYPE - Each {LINK:OrganicPage;food} type has its own decay properties. {THING:ItemTomatoSoup} lasts a lot longer than a {THING:ItemTomato}, for instance.
- PRESSURE - Food decays faster when the pressure drops below 1 atmosphere (101kPa). Decay happens exponentially more quickly as the atmosphere approaches a perfect vacuum. There is no effect from higher pressures.
- ATMOSPHERE - Different gases can slow and accelerate the decay process. The process will take account of respective gas ratios in mixed atmospheres in calculating the decay modifier. The following rates apply across all foods:
> {GAS:Oxygen} x 1.3 > {GAS:Nitrogen} x 0.6 > {GAS:CarbonDioxide} x 0.8 > {GAS:Volatiles} x 1 > {GAS:Pollutant} x 3 > {GAS:NitrousOxide} x 1.5 > {GAS:Water} x 2 > Vacuum (see PRESSURE above)
StructureShelfMedium Shelf Medium A shelf for putting things on, so you can see them.
PassiveSpeaker Passive Speaker
DeviceLfoVolume Low frequency oscillator The low frequency oscillator (or LFO) makes everything sound dark, twisted and crunchy by altering the shape of the waves output by a {THING:LogicStepSequencer8}.
To set up an LFO:
1. Place the LFO unit 2. Set the LFO output to a {THING:PassiveSpeaker} 2. Set a sequencers' output to LFO - so the sequencer's signal runs through the LFO to a speaker. 3. Place a {THING:StopWatch} or use an existing one, then use a {THING:StructureLogicWriter} to write it to the LFO. 4. Use another logic writer to write the BPM to the LFO. 5. You are ready. This is the future. You're in space. Make it sound cool.
For more info, check out the {LINK:MusicPage;music page}.
StructureFridgeBig Fridge (Large) The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} Koolaid fridge is a self-cooling storage device with 15 slots that preserves food when powered and turned on. While many users have complained about the placement of the power switch, its place in the pantheon of off-world whiteware is unquestioned.
With its own permanent internal atmosphere, the Koolaid fridge slows the decay of {LINK:OrganicPage;food} by maintaining an optimal internal temperature. Its power usage varies on the external temperature against which it must balance its internal temperature. As such, it must shed heat to operate, so the Koolaid fridge DOES NOT work in a vacuum.
Also, don't leave the door open, as it will equalize with the current world temperature. And maybe start to beep.
For more information about food preservation, visit the {LINK:DecayPage;food decay} section of the Stationpedia.
ItemKitFridgeBig Kit (Fridge Large) This kit creates a {THING:StructureFridgeBig}.
StructureFridgeSmall Fridge Small Essentially a heavily insulated box that allows users to pipe in any desired atmosphere, the {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} Minibar fridge was a simple solution to the problem of {LINK:NutritionPage;food decay}. It stores a small number of items, at any temperature you can muster.
For more information about food preservation, visit the {LINK:DecayPage;food decay} section of the Stationpedia.
StructureRefrigeratedVendingMachine Refrigerated Vending Machine The refrigerated OmniKool vending machine is an advanced version of the standard {THING:StructureVendingMachine}, which maintains an optimum pressure and constant temperature of -130 degrees C, to prevent food spoilage. It can hold up to 100 stacks. The OmniKool also has an in-built {THING:StructureStacker}, allowing players to set the stack sizes of any items ADDED to the device. The unit's default stack size is 50. NOTE: altering stack sizes DOES NOT update existing stacks within the machine, only those subsequently added.

Fertilizer Fertilizer Fertilizer alters plant growth processes, and is created by the basic composter and the {THING:StructureAdvancedComposter} using {LINK:OrganicPage;organic} matter. Fertilizer's affects depend on its ingredients:
- {LINK:OrganicPage;Food} increases PLANT YIELD up to two times - {THING:DecayedFood} increases plant GROWTH SPEED up to two times - {THING:ItemBiomass} increases the NUMBER OF GROWTH CYCLES the fertilizer lasts for
The effect of these ingredients depends on their respective proportions in the composter when processing is activated.
StructureAdvancedComposter Advanced Composter The advanced composter creates {THING:Fertilizer} out of organic matter. It accepts {LINK:OrganicPage;food}, {THING:DecayedFood} or {THING:ItemBiomass}. It requires {GAS:Water} and power to operate, accelerating the natural composting process. When processing, it releases nitrogen and volatiles, as well a small amount of heat.
{HEADER:Compost composition} Fertilizer is produced at a 1:3 ratio of fertilizer to ingredients. The fertilizer's effects on plants will vary depending on the respective proportions of its ingredients.
- {LINK:OrganicPage;Food} increases PLANT YIELD up to two times - {THING:DecayedFood} increases plant GROWTH SPEED up to two times - {THING:ItemBiomass} increases the NUMBER OF GROWTH CYCLES the fertilizer lasts for up to five times

{HEADER:Compost composition} Fertilizer is produced at a 1:3 ratio of fertilizer to ingredients. The fertilizer's effects on plants will vary depending on the respective proportions of its ingredients.
- {LINK:OrganicPage;food} increases PLANT YIELD up to two times - {THING:DecayedFood} increases plant GROWTH SPEED up to two times - {THING:ItemBiomass} increases the NUMBER OF GROWTH CYCLES the fertilizer lasts for
AppliancePackagingMachine Basic Packaging Machine The {LINK:Xigo;Xigo} Cannifier requires {THING:ItemEmptyCan} and cooked {LINK:OrganicPage;food} to create {LINK:DecayPage;long-lasting}, easily stored sustenance. Note that the Cannifier must be bolted to a {THING:StructureBench} for power, and only accepts cooked food and tin cans.
{HEADER:OPERATION}
1. Add the correct ingredients to the device via the hopper in the TOP.
2. Close the device using the dropdown handle.
3. Activate the device.
4. Remove canned goods from the outlet in the FRONT.
Note: the Cannifier will flash an error on its activation switch if you attempt to activate it before closing it.

StructureHorizontalAutoMiner OGRE The {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} OGRE (Orthogonal Ground Rotating Excavator) is a base structure with attached mining vehicle, which will mine a horizontal shaft up to X meters long. When full, the mining vehicle will return to the base to empty itself, before returning to dig. If it encounters empty space, it will also return to base and await instruction. The unit will return if deactivated.
The OGRE can be connected to a chute system, and is controllable by a logic network. Note that the OGRE outputs more {LINK:OrePage;ore} than a conventional {THING:ItemMiningDrill} over the same area, due to more efficient processing.
{HEADER:MODES} Idle - 0 Mining - 1 Returning - 2 DepostingOre - 3 Finished - 4
StructureReinforcedCompositeWindow Reinforced Window (Composite) Enjoy vistas of even the most savage, alien landscapes with these heavy duty window frames, which are resistant to pressure differentials up to 1MPa.

StructureReinforcedWallPaddedWindowThin Reinforced Window (Thin) Enjoy vistas of even the most savage, alien landscapes with these heavy duty window frames, which are resistant to pressure differentials up to 1MPa.
ItemStelliteGlassSheets Item Stellite Glass Sheets A stronger glass substitute.
ItemKitReinforcedWindows Reinforced Windows (Kit) Creates {THING:StructureReinforcedCompositeWindow} and other variants.
ItemKitHorizontalAutoMiner Kit (OGRE) Creates a {THING:StructureHorizontalAutoMiner}.
ItemLaptop Laptop A portable IC editor, the {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} 'Slaptop' was designed for rugged use and abuse by intrepid {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} across the Solar System. While it will never replace the multifunctionality of the {THING:StructureComputer}, the Slaptop's low weight and portability have earned it a place in many an ODA operative's heart.
The Slaptop requires a {THING:MotherboardProgrammableChip} for operation.
ItemPlantEndothermic_Genepool1 Winterspawn (Alpha variant) {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero's} Winterspawn atmospheric bio-processor is a recent addition to their catalogue of genespliced environmental decorations. Using ambient heat to split {GAS:Water} into {GAS:Volatiles} and {GAS:Oxygen}, the Winterspawn cools its surroundings, when supplied with sufficient {GAS:Nitrogen}. The alpha variant has a peak cooling and electrolysis capacity of 90Watts and is most efficient operating in air temperatures of 0 to 40 Degrees Celsius.
ItemPlantEndothermic_Genepool2 Winterspawn (Beta variant) {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero's} Winterspawn atmospheric bio-processor is a recent addition to their catalogue of genespliced environmental decorations. Using ambient heat to split {GAS:Water} into {GAS:Volatiles} and {GAS:Oxygen}, the Winterspawn cools its surroundings when supplied with sufficient {GAS:Nitrogen}. The beta variant has a peak cooling and electrolysis capacity of 150Watts and is most efficient operating in air temperatures of 14 to 24 Degrees Celsius.
ItemPlantThermogenic_Genepool1 Hades Flower (Alpha strain) The {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero's}-created Hades Flower is the result of as dubious experiment to combine the allure of tropical plants with the comfort and homeliness of a heat pump. The plant breathes a 1:3 mix of {GAS:Volatiles} and {GAS:Oxygen}, and exhales heated {GAS:Pollutant}.
ItemPlantThermogenic_Genepool2 Hades Flower (Beta strain) The {LINK:Agrizero;Agrizero's}-created Hades Flower is the result of as dubious experiment to combine the allure of tropical plants with the comfort and homeliness of a heat pump. The plant breathes a 1:3 mix of {GAS:Volatiles} and {GAS:Oxygen}, and exhales heated {GAS:Pollutant}. The beta strain is notably more efficient than the earlier, more experimental alpha variant.
ItemKitStirlingEngine Kit (Stirling Engine) Creates a {THING:StructureStirlingEngine}.
StructureStirlingEngine Stirling Engine Harnessing an ancient thermal exploit, the {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} 'Libra' Stirling Engine generates power via the expansion and contraction of a working gas to drive pistons operating an electrical generator.
When high pressure hot gas is supplied into the input pipe, this gas will heat the hot side of the unit, then pass into the output pipe. The cooler side uses the room's ambient atmosphere, which must be kept at a lower temperature and pressure in order to create a differential. Add a working gas by inserting a {SLOT:GasCanister}. The unit must be deactivated when adding or removing canisters, or the working gas may leak into the surrounding atmosphere.
Gases with a low molecular mass make the most efficient working gases. Increasing the moles of working gas can result in a greater potential power output. However, overpressuring the unit may have ... sub-optimal results.
StructurePowerTransmitter Microwave Power Transmitter The {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} Wireless Power Transmitter is an uni-directional, A-to-B, far field microwave electrical transmission system.The rotatable base transmitter delivers a narrow, non-lethal microwave beam to a dedicated base receiver. The transmitter must be aligned to the base station in order to transmit any power. The brightness of the transmitter's collimator arc provides an indication of transmission intensity. Note that there is an attrition over longer ranges, so the unit requires more power over greater distances to deliver the same output.
StructurePowerTransmitterReceiver Microwave Power Receiver The {LINK:Norsec;Norsec} Wireless Power Transmitter is an uni-directional, A-to-B, far field microwave electrical transmission system.The rotatable base transmitter delivers a narrow, non-lethal microwave beam to a dedicated base receiver. The transmitter must be aligned to the base station in order to transmit any power. The brightness of the transmitter's collimator arc provides an indication of transmission intensity. Note that there is an attrition over longer ranges, so the unit requires more power over greater distances to deliver the same output.

If pointed at the sun it will heat its contents rapidly via solar heating. The panels can fold away to stop all heat radiation/solar heating and protect them from storms.

ItemNitrice Ice (Nitrice) Nitrice is the nickname given to solid {GAS:Nitrogen} Ice, and found on many planets and moons in the Solar System. Given the inert nature of the {GAS:Nitrogen} it produces, the ice is useful when making breathable atmospheres with low flammability.
Highly sensitive to temperature, nitrice will begin to melt as soon as it is mined, unless the temperature is below zero, or it is stored in the {THING:ItemMiningBelt}, {THING:ItemMiningBeltAdvanced} or devices like the {THING:StructureIceCrusher} or {THING:StructureFridgeSmall}.
ItemKitPassiveLargeRadiator Kit (Medium Radiator) Creates {THING:StructureMediumRadiator} and {THING:StructureMediumConvectionRadiator}.
StructurePassiveLargeRadiator Medium Convection Radiator Has been replaced by {THING:StructureMediumConvectionRadiator}.

StructureLogicGate Logic Gate A {LINK:LogicPage;logic} device that performs a logical operation on one or more binary inputs that produces a single binary output. An input greater than zero is considered true for operations.
StructureNitrolyzer Nitrolyzer This device is used to create {GAS:NitrousOxide} from {GAS:Oxygen}, {GAS:Nitrogen}, and a large amount of energy. The process does not completely transform all the available gas at once, so the output is a mix of all three gasses, which may need further processing. More NOS will be created, if the gas inside the machine is close to a 1/1 ratio of Oxygen to Nitrogen. The second gas input line in optional, and not required if the gas is pre mixed.
ItemMiningBackPack Mining Backpack
ItemHardMiningBackPack Hard Mining Backpack
StructureH2Combustor Structure H2 Combustor Adapted slightly from its original {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} design, the {GAS:Volatiles} Combustor does exactly what its name suggests - it burns a mixture of volatiles and {GAS:Oxygen} to create water. Extremely useful in hot or arid environments, users need to be aware that the combustor outputs considerable waste heat. The device is also less than perfectly efficient, resulting in the autoignition of volatiles in the chamber, and the production of waste gases which must be dealt with.
StructurePipeRadiatorFlat Pipe Radiator A pipe mounted radiator omptimised for radiating heat in vacuums and low pressure ebvironments.
StructurePipeRadiatorFlatLiquid Pipe Radiator Liquid A liquid pipe mounted radiator omptimised for radiating heat in vacuums and low pressure environments.

StructureMediumRadiatorLiquid Medium Radiator Liquid A stand-alone liquid radiator unit omptimised for radiating heat in vacuums and low pressure environments.
StructureMediumConvectionRadiatorLiquid Medium Convection Radiator Liquid A stand-alone liquid radiator unit omptimised for exchanging heat with its surrounding atmosphere.

ItemKitPipeRadiatorLiquid Kit (Pipe Radiator Liquid) This kit creates a {THING:StructurePipeRadiatorFlatLiquid} and {THING:StructureLiquidPipeRadiator}.
StructureCryoTubeVertical Cryo Tube Vertical The vertical variant of the cryo tube. Will heal players and organs as well as revive dead players when provided with an atmosphere of NOS below -150C.
StructureCryoTubeHorizontal Cryo Tube Horizontal The horizontal variant of the cryo tube. Will heal players and organs as well as revive dead players when provided with an atmosphere of NOS below -150C.
StructureDeepMiner Deep Miner Drills through terrain until it hits bedrock. Once inside bedrock {THING:ItemDirtyOre} is produced every roughly every 90s
StructureSleeperVertical Sleeper Vertical The vertical variant of the sleeper. Will keep players hydrated and fed while they are logged out - as long as a breatheable atmosphere is provided.
StructureSleeperLeft Sleeper Left A horizontal variant of the sleeper. Will keep players hydrated and fed while they are logged out - as long as a breatheable atmosphere is provided.
StructureSleeperRight Sleeper Right A horizontal variant of the sleeper. Will keep players hydrated and fed while they are logged out - as long as a breatheable atmosphere is provided.
StructureProximitySensor Proximity Sensor Will be triggered if there is a player in the range of the sensor (as defined by the setting dial). The quantity variable will show the number of players. You can configure the sensor to only detect players who hold the correct Access Card using a {THING:CartridgeAccessController} in a {THING:ItemTablet}.
StructureOccupancySensor Occupancy Sensor Will be triggered if there is a player in the same room as the sensor. The quantity variable will show the number of players. You can use configure it to only detect players who hold the correct Access Card using a {THING:CartridgeAccessController} in a {THING:ItemTablet}. This sensor only works when placed in a room.
ItemKitDeepMiner Kit (Deep Miner) Creates {THING:StructureDeepMiner} which can drill through the terrain into bedrock to mine {THING:ItemDirtyOre}
ItemDirtyOre Item Dirty Ore Ore mined from bedrock via the {THING:StructureDeepMiner} which then can be used in the {THING:StructureCentrifuge}, or {THING:StructureCombustionCentrifuge}. Once processed, it produces ore in a ratio similar to the average found on the planet's surface.
StructureChuteFlipFlopSplitter Chute Flip Flop Splitter A chute that toggles between two outputs
StructureChuteValve Chute Valve The Chute Valve will stop the flow of materials when set to closed and when set to open, will act like a straight chute.
StructureCombustionCentrifuge Combustion Centrifuge The Combustion Centrifuge is a gas powered version of the {THING:StructureCentrifuge}. A combustible fuel mix should be supplied to the gas input, and waste gasses should be vented from the output. The machine's RPMs must be controlled via the throttle and combustion limitor levers. If the Combustion Centrifuge gains, or looses, RPMs too fast it will experience stress, and eventually grind to a halt. Higher RPMs directly result in faster processing speeds. The throttle lever controls the amount of fuel being pulled into the machine, increasing the temperature inside the engine, and leading to an increase in RPM. The limitor lever influences the speed of the combustion, and how much uncombusted gas is in the exhaust. Ejecting ore from the Combustion Centrifuge while it is at high RPMs will result in additional stress build up. If turned off while not stressed, the machine will automatically start to brake, and reduce RPMs in a controlled manner.
StructureChuteOverflow Chute Overflow The overflow chute will direct materials to its overflow port when the thing connected to its default port is already occupied.
KitStructureCombustionCentrifuge Kit (Combustion Centrifuge)
StructureChuteDigitalValveLeft Chute Digital Valve Left The Digital Chute Valve will stop the flow of materials when set to closed and when set to open, will act like a straight chute. The valve will automatically close after a certain number of items have passed through. This threshold can be set using the dial.
StructureChuteDigitalValveRight Chute Digital Valve Right The Digital Chute Valve will stop the flow of materials when set to closed and when set to open, will act like a straight chute. The valve will automatically close after a certain number of items have passed through. This threshold can be set using the dial.
StructureChuteDigitalFlipFlopSplitterLeft Chute Digital Flip Flop Splitter Left The digital flip flop will toggle between two outputs using a specified ratio (n:1). For example, setting the dial to 2 would allow two items to pass through the primary output before flipping to the secondary output.
StructureChuteDigitalFlipFlopSplitterRight Chute Digital Flip Flop Splitter Right The digital flip flop will toggle between two outputs using a specified ratio (n:1). For example, setting the dial to 2 would allow two items to pass through the primary output before flipping to the secondary output.
ItemKitStandardChute Kit (Powered Chutes) This kit produces a variety of powered chutes

Loulan, upon arrival you will notice a breathable atmosphere, high enough pressure to sustain life - but a severe lack of it. This sandy giant is situated in the Gargantuan System, moving closer to the black hole situated in the centre each day. While abandoned and no longer green and full of {GAS:Water}, this planet still has a functioning atmosphere and you are tasked with scouring the wasteland to acquire the materials and resources needed to survive on this everlasting desert.

So you're stuck on the moon, but it's not all bad.Sure, it's cold, harsh and pretty monotonous, but at least the sun's shining. The solar panel is going to be useful, and the power controller... and probably the arc furnace too. There's even a little food and oxygen in the other crates, though it's definitely not going to last forever. Neither's your battery. You better start thinking about how you're going to survive. How hard could it be to rig up an airlock? A generator? Maybe even smelt some ore and build yourself a base? Looks like you're gonna be here a while.

This is Stationeers Creative Mode!Spawn in any item, test ideas and build bonkers stuff real fast. <color=red>This mode is experimental. Think of it as a freeform space party where exciting and unexpected things* can and will happen, compared to the more reliable near-death experience of Survival Mode. Just don't be sad when you blow yourself into tiny, tiny little pieces or get savaged by chickens or slowly explode while drifting alone into the infinite void. *bugs

A desolate dusty red ball, Mars features more varied terrain that can reach into the sky, and a chilly atmosphere that's no good for breathing, but maybe it can be used for something ...

While the presence of coal isn't typical of Earth's Moon, the relatively flat terrain full of various sizeable craters and lack of atmosphere may be more familiar in this grey landscape. A great location for the budding Stationeer to begin their journey, with fewer of the hazards and complexities offered on more exotic worlds

While there's no gravity or atmosphere, at least there's a lot of space to build! You'll find yourself amongst several asteroids that may contain various ores and ices you can use to survive out here.

Unvarying extreme temperatures and ultra-high pressures make Venus no place for the faint-hearted. Only the most accomplished Stationeers will survive on our once-sister planet, now a barren rock. Dig deep, or go home.

Melting some of the ice on this cold world has finally given it an atmosphere, but it's extremely frigid environment presents a serious challenge for the stationeers.The extreme cold will cause batteries to rapidly lose power, so getting a steady power source and warm location are your priorities.
The volatile environment on Vulcan is surviable for very few living organisms, but it's fractured surface and rich mineral deposits make it a risky but profitable venture for enterprising traders.

A world torn apart due to massive tidal forces from the supermassive black hole it orbits. Vulcan offers little hope for any organism that ends up here, but it's fractured surface and rich mineral deposits make it a risky but profitable venture for enterprising traders.Watch out for the deep crevasses that lead to deadly magma flows beneath the surface!

A barren rock nestled under the wing of Saturn's spectular rings. Mimas tiny stature is reflected in its extremely low gravity, and the Mimantean surface is saturated with impact craters from wayward ring occupants. It's distance from the sun provides little power from solar devices.Be very careful when walking or jumping, as you can travel a long way and gain a lot of speed due to the extremely low gravity.

Whether driven by concerns for clarity, safety or simple aesthetics, {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeers} have access to a small rainbow of colors for their constructions. These are the color setting for devices, represented as an integer.
0: Blue 1: Grey 2: Green 3: Orange 4: Red 5: Yellow 6: White 7: Black 8: Brown 9: Khaki 10: Pink 11: Purple
It is an unwavering universal law that anything higher than 11 will be purple. The {LINK:ODA;ODA} is powerless to change this. Similarly, anything lower than 0 will be Blue.

Agrizero is an agricultural biotech firm focused on researching and deploying offworld farming technology. The company’s aim is to provide a network of self-sustaining, self-contained 'bio-factories' that will ultimately feed a projected 1 million humans in space. Emerging from the late 21st century's environmental disasters, the firm has roots in China's world-saving artificial farming initiatives, and has now spread to facilities in the Asteroid Belt, where the supply of ice asteroids makes vertical farming and controlled-environment agriculture extremely promising. While many of their facilities are still under construction, Agrizero is already one of the main suppliers of offworld groups like {LINK:ODA;ODA}, {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai} and {LINK:ExMin;ExMin} through the ever-expanding Trader Network.

Asura Biomedia was founded in the early 22nd century by Mumbai-based trillionaire Ashan Gurwaja. Nominally focused on 'biotechnology', the company has always had an ‘elastic’ notion of exactly what that entailed: everything from pharmaceuticals to pet food. Gurwaja's background in bio-engineering firms put the company in the highest echelon of bio-science industries from the very beginning, and it grew exactly as its founder intended: rapidly and reliably, structured specifically to swallow up any smaller firms in its way. Near mid-century, Asura's ambitions evolved to embrace entire health systems – it is now the largest provider of healthcare on Earth, integrating hospitals and primary care with medical supplies, pharmaceutical production and retail, residential care and funeral services. By 2150, Asura's business was a simple proposition, as captured in their famous – if not infamous – advertising slogan: 'We're in you'.

Founded in 2085 to produce weapons for {LINK:Sinotai;Sinotai}'s space forces, the company is known for making highly reliable and affordable weapons for off-world use. Their pragmatic approach is reflected in their focus on designs suitable for 3D printing and mass production, as well as a high reuse of components across models and weapon classes. As a result, although CHAC guns excel in no particular category, and have certainly never been accused of gretness, they suffer no great failings, and perform sufficiently well by most known measures to have earned their designers the informal title of 'armorer to the Solar System'.

In the aftermath of the Sisyphus disaster on Mars in 2079, asteroid shifting was officially banned by the {LINK:ODA;ODA}. This sea-change forced the newborn space mining industry to reconsider its strategies, but until the opening of the Manaus Space Elevator, marginal economics meant offworld resource extraction was effectively impossible. Formed in 2095 by a long-standing Swiss-German mining conglomerate and a consortium of other interests, ExMin was more an idea than a commercial reality for several decades. Created with the certainty that a space elevator would eventually arrive, ExMin was one of the first to exploit the access it offered. Subsequently it has become one of the Solar System's most powerful commercial entities. With access to space secure, ExMin became a central player in the flow of resources to the Inner System. It has competition, principally from Brazilian mining giant {LINK:Recurso;Recurso}, but the company has never entirely lost its lead on off-world mining. Synonymous with rare earth metals and pioneering off-world resource extraction, it stands at the forefront of development throughout the Solar System.

Officially known as Gewehrfabrik GmbH, GeFabrik is one of the world’s oldest and most highly regarded armament firms, known for producing exceptionally accurate, high-end firearms. In the wake of the European arms manufacturing collapse in the 2030s, a group of unemployed armament staff formed GeFabrik. Dedicated to renewing original design principles, the company is legendary for extensive testing, sometimes lasting as long as 10 years, in order to produce ‘ganz’ weapon formats. GeFabrik is widely regarded as having single-handedly salvaged Germany's manufacturing reputation, while doing nothing for their sense of humor.

Founded by Noboru Hiiragi in the aftermath of the 2110s economic bubble, Hiiragi Communications absorbed several prominent offworld assets, quickly becoming the most widely used trans-Solar System communications network. If you’ve communicated with friends and family offworld recently, it’s been through the Hiiragi network, even if it’s been branded under one of its many child companies. Hiiragi is also the number one seller for PCD’s (Personal Communication Devices) as well as a deep, if difficult to assess investor in terrestrial telecommunication networks.

With its roots in early 20th Century defense industry, Norsec (a.k.a. Northern Security Systems) was an early adopter of asteroid mining – one of its tugs being involved in the infamous Sisyphus Hit on the fledgling Martian colony at Sanders. Norsec was officially cleared of any wrong-doing, but when the {LINK:ODA;ODA} banned asteroidal relocation, the company shifted its focus to infrastructure and manufacturing. Norsec’s orbitally-based Space Systems Division is responsible for the design and production of {LINK:ODA;ODA}’s core transport systems, while also being rumoured to hold a large interest in {LINK:ExMin;ExMin}. The company is also noted for its willingness to engage in experimental robotic technology.

In the aftermath of the Earth Crisis, humanity’s focus on space diminished. Yet many felt that, without ambitions beyond our home planet, our species might falter. Created in 2070CE by a newly revamped United Nations, the Offworld Development Agency was given a very specific goal - to guide and encourage human space exploration at a time the cosmos was fading from the public mind. It inaugurated the {LINK:Stationeers;Stationeer} Program in 2095. Understanding that funding would be difficult to come by, the ODA conceived the program as a slow-burn, low-outlay space initiative. While some derided Stationeers as 'cut-price cosmic castaways', the success of the program is testament to the wisdom and pragmatism of ODA's vision.

This long-standing Brazilian mining group branched into space in the late 21st century. Focused primarily on bulk minerals and metals, the company is perhaps best understood as an extension of the Brazilian government – very few upper echelon political figures in modern Brazil are not implicated in one arm or another of this industrial behemoth. Enmeshment with South American politics has given the company heavy influence over the Manaus space elevator. This deep state control has led to other groups – the {LINK:ODA;ODA} included – to exercise a certain ‘flexibility’ toward Recurso. Accusations of illegal asteroid relocation, safety violations and numerous commercial infringements have barely touched it. Meanwhile, defenders point out that very little has been proven in court, and Recurso is hardly alone – hence the truism: 'In space, we all live in glass houses.'

The sole 'traditional' state entity to survive offworld politics, Sinotai’s reach and power is second only to the {LINK:ODA;ODA} itself. In many ways a relic – a sub-agency of a staggeringly complicated Earth-bound corporate-bureaucracy – its structure has allowed Sinotai to achieve incredible things. Proving its mettle in the early 21st Century by putting the first humans on Mars, establishing the first offworld gigawatt power system, and the first space-borne fuel refinery, few space-going organisations lack some degree of relationship with Sinotai. A common joke has it that it's impossible to do anything in space without them. Regardless of the truth, Sinotai's approach to off-world development has involved a 'soft power' approach, from MOU's with {LINK:Recurso;Recurso} (giving them preferential access to the Manaus space elevator) to murkier alliances of convenience with a range of Trader groups.

Originally a defense contractor specializing in brute force, high power weaponry, Tanzanian Kinetic Systems executed a large-scale, peace-time pivot to become the African Assembly’s leading designer of high-speed goods conveyors. Now producing a range of chute network designs and components, TK has a strong offworld presence as a result of the Afro-Sino partnerships in the latter 21st Century. Based in the ‘reconned’ Kigamboni district of Dar E Salaam, the Company regularly enters into development partnerships with {LINK:CHAC;CHAC} and, as a result, many of their products show distinct similarities. After all, what is a gun but a ‘high speed goods conveyor’.

A 2150CE survey revealed the Xigo 'X' as one of the most recognized symbols in the world. Yet few participants could clearly describe the company's actual scope. Precisely where the company begins and ends has been the subject of endless theories, financial studies and lawsuits – originally a website for price comparisons, the conglomerate expanded to embrace data, then distribution and finally production. It was a seemingly indiscriminate expansion, focused not on one industry, but all of them – taking in so many fields that business analysts have largely rejected the idea of Xigo as a single entity. Rather, it is a conceptual grouping for a branch of human activity. And while such statistics are – by their very nature – difficult to confirm, recent estimates suggest Xigo employs over 1.5% of the entire human race. Suffice to say, it produces almost everything.

In the early 22nd century, Earth was emerging from a cataclysm. Its resources eroded, our population reduced, rebuilding was the spirit of the era. Initiated by the {LINK:ODA;Offworld Development Agency} (ODA) in 2095CE, the Stationeers Program was dedicated to a single ideal: keeping humanity pointed at the stars. Stationeers are everything: astronauts, engineers and explorers, deployed with limited equipment and tools, trained to do more with less. Turning the environment to their advantage, their job is to provide infrastructure for humans in space, at a fraction of the cost of traditional space programs. Able to build and maintain bases anywhere from the Moon to Mimas and beyond, Stationeers are our vanguard in the cosmos. Schooled in offworld survival, mining and construction techniques, basic metallurgy, electronics, rocketry, hydroponics and more ‘arcane’ sciences, Stationeers do what they must to survive, and thrive. Renowned for having no entry criteria, there is no such thing as a ‘typical’ Stationeer. Psychological profiling suggests successful Cadets show a ‘baseline’ pragmatism and single-mindedness, but some of the most famous Stationeers possess neither of these qualities. Recruiting from civil engineering backgrounds, military and aerospace industries, software development, mining groups, as well as scientific fields and even religious orders, the Stationeers Program is – fundamentally – open to all humanity.

Oxygen provides energy when released in combustion, and also bonds with hydrogen to create {GAS:Water}. It is created by {LINK:OrganicPage;plants}, as well as from processing {THING:ItemOxite}. It is highly flammable at low temperatures.

{GAS:Nitrogen} can be mixed with {GAS:Oxygen} to stablize its flammability and avoid {GAS:Oxygen} toxicity, and is a resource in its own right, useful for creating, a breathable atmosphere (at roughly 3:1 {GAS:Nitrogen} and {GAS:Oxygen}). The most efficient source of {GAS:Nitrogen} is from {THING:ItemNitrice} deposites found around the Solar System.

You breathe it out, {LINK:OrganicPage;plants} breath it in. They don't grow without it. You can use items placed in {SLOT:GasFilter} slots to remove this from the atmosphere.
{GAS:CarbonDioxide} has a moderately high specific heat, meaning it makes a good coolant for devices like the Wall Coo {THING:StructureWallCooler}. {GAS:Water} is better, but usually has more important uses.

Volatiles are an extremely reactive, complex organic molecule, which can be used in conjunction with oxygen as a combustible fuel. It is refined from {THING:ItemVolatiles}.
Due to obscure and largely forgotten {LINK:ODA;ODA} regulations, volatiles are sometimes labelled 'H2' by various items of technology. However, though they are similar to hydrogen, they're not 'actually' hydrogen. {GAS:Volatiles} will not produce {GAS:Water} when combusted, without a catalyst (see the {THING:H2Combustor}). Alone, they create {GAS:Pollutant}s and {GAS:CarbonDioxide} when burned in the following ratio:
2 {GAS:Volatiles} + 1 {GAS:Oxygen} -> 3 {GAS:Pollutant} + 6 {GAS:CarbonDioxide} + heat.

Also known as 'X', {GAS:Pollutant} is created when smelting certain metals. A concentration of 0.1 mol or greater will cause your suit to warn about poison in the atmosphere.
Pollutant has a high specific heat, making it an excellent coolant. Unfortunately it is extremely bad for organic beings, and will severely damage the lungs of most {REAGENT:Carbon} based organisms.

You can obtain water by smelting or crushing {THING:ItemIce} using a {THING:StructureFurnace} or an {THING:StructureIceCrusher}, or by combusting {GAS:Volatiles} and oxygen using the {THING:H2Combustor}.
{GAS:Water} is critical for {LINK:OrganicPage;plants} to stay alive, and grow {LINK:NutritionPage;food}. It is also an exceptional coolant with a very high specific heat capacity.
Note: {GAS:Water} was previously treated as a gas, but a new system for liquids is being developed, including separate pipes, tanks, pumps, etc for liquids. {GAS:Water} is currently the only available liquid, and does not presently change states.
Nitrous oxide is an inert gas that will knock players out if inhaled. It makes your {THING:ItemJetpackBasic} go whoosh.
